text:
UnavailableException extends ServletException, which has a rootCause as a read-
only attribute : the rootCause is intialised in some constructors of 
ServletException.

There is no UnavailableException constructor which can initialize a rootCause.
Then, when for example you catch an SQLException during init of your servlet, 
you'd like to throw an UnavailableException, but you can't wrap the rootCause. 
Then you're forced to throw a simple ServletException.
